intro: Margaritopsis cymuligera, commonly known as the clustered margarita, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered together, giving it its common name. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
